results.title: Jaipur
results.creator_credit: Shanti Varma, Ezra Mir and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: The ancient rose-red city of Jaipur and the surrounding country of Rajput. Designed on a grand scale by Jai Singh in 1728, the walled city contains many remarkable temples, gardens and palaces. Nearby is the old palace, with man]gnificent frescoes, inlay work and decorated ceilings. The fort recalls the history of Rajput and its defence against waves of invaders. The observatory built by Jai Singh; collections of manuscripts and paintings; Palace of Winds; craftsmen at work.

results.title: Jail Bait
results.creator_credit: Charles Lamont and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A comedy film starring Buster Keaton. Keaton plays the role of a character who gets caught up in a twisted plot to catch a murderer. Keaton agrees to participate in the plot after being promised a share of the reward money.

results.title: Jade Snow
results.creator_credit: Ron Finley, Nola Safro, Films Incorporated and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)
results.brief_description: The Chinese-American success story of Jade Snow Wong who rejected the traditional role of female subservience to her father and brother and became an accomplished author. Shows the differences in family life-styles between American and Chinese-Americans. Very moving bio-pic of this 5th daughter who graduated with honours, won a State essay prize and worked for the Navy during World War II.

results.title: Jacqueline du Pre
results.brief_description: Jacqueline du Pre, a sixteen year old girl who was a pupil of Pablo Casals and described by critics as one of the world’s greatest cellists. Accompanied by Iris du Pre on the piano, she plays ‘Song Without Words’ Opus 109 by Mendelsohn, ‘Intermezzo’ from ‘Goyescas’ by Granados and ‘Allegro Appassionato’ by Saint-Saens. Presented by Patricia Foy.

results.title: Jacob's dream
results.creator_credit: Alan Madden and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: In both his sleeping and waking hours, Jacob encounters a character who provides the basis for the script of his short film; an assessment panel is not impressed. Cast includes John Penman, Bryon Williams, Edward Rosser, John Phillips, Taylor Owynns. Cinematography by Peter Tammer. Music composed and conducted by Christopher Gordon.

results.title: Jackson Pollock What Kind of Risk
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Risk”.
Jackson Pollock (1912-1956) was the leading exponent of what is usually called Abstract Expressionist Art. Charles Harrison examines a number of Pollock’s paintings, and discusses how they were made and what they represent. Includes some film of Pollock himself working on a painting in 1952

results.title: Jabs and jolts
results.creator_credit: Castle Films and United World Films
results.brief_description: Tongue-in-cheek examination of the sport of boxing and wrestling. Stresses the gentle good humour of inflicting violence on others. Combines an appreciation of beautifully choreographed physical theatre with a genuine affection for the comical aspects of these civil athletic pastimes.

results.title: Jabberwocky
results.brief_description: Using Lewis Carrol’s famous poem as a starting point, this film uses an animated sequence of images composed of Victoriana props, toys and games of childhood to create a surrealist fantasy.
